alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 4:27PM EDT until July 21 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: The National Weather Service in Caribou Maine has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Aroostook County in northern Maine... * Until 530 PM EDT. * At 427 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 13 miles east of Saint Pamphile to near Clayton Lake, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Fort Kent, Eagle Lake, Allagash, Deboullie Mountain, Frenchville, Portage Lake, New Canada, Allagash Township, Cross Lake, Fish River Lake, Dickey, Madawaska Lake, Wallagrass, Winterville, Saint Francis, Daigle, Guerette, Soldier Pond, Saint Agatha and Round Pond. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
